page.title: 02FARMS IN UDIMORE
page.content: Farms wholly contained within this block average 200 _ 250 acres. Crops grown are wheat, barley, oats, oil_seed rape, kale, fruit, grass and a few hops. Hop_gardens have diminished by at least 70% in the last few years. The fruit consists of apples, pears and soft fruit. Much of the soft fruit is sold on a 'pick your own' basis. Grass is grazed by sheep, with a few cattle in the Brede Valley. A small amount of hay is produced. It is interesting to note the change from mixed farming to the present concentration on one or two crops per farm. Much grassland has been ploughed and given over to cereal production. Many old orchards have been grubbed, including apples pears, cherries and plums. Sheep numbers have increased with new breeds being introduced.
